website_summaries.verdict: Simple, but sturdy with a straight forward pressure mounting system that makes installation a breeze. No holes, no wrestling with hardware.
pros: Steel frame is surprisingly sturdy, considering the price
Safety lock has an indicator that lets users know it's closed securely
Adheres to JMPA and ASTM standards
cons: Latch can be difficult to open with one hand

website_summaries.verdict: The best bang for your buck. The price is right and this gate will last for a while. A couple of minor complaints, but this is a great choice.
pros: Good price, solid design, and works as advertised
cons: Extends to 40 inches, but you have to use a 6-inch extension to get there
Hard to operate with one hand

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but be careful where you put it.
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these now, and they work great. They're easy to set up. They have a slight learning curve on opening them one-handed, but it's not bad. However, on neither of our gates did we choose to use the wall cups. Oil or moisture has since leeched out of the rubber feet onto our wall, permanently staining them. We have planning on painting this foyer anyways, but just be aware of this if you're purchasing the product.
customer_reviews.author: DWH

customer_reviews.title: Solid gate. Crazy dog. Gate wins.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gate. Tall enough to keep my psycho shitzu poodle downstairs and he has been known to kamikaze over any object we put in front of him. Built strong and stays put too. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Schommer

customer_reviews.title: “Space fits” is falsely advertised. Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this in an opening of 33 inches wide. With the extension it doesnt fit. And without the extension the gate is too loose. No happy medium. This gate is poorly made. If u need to use the adjustable knobs to fit in an opening then the fence will be very loose to the touch. I lightly pushed the fence and the knobs just popped off and fence fell down. Defitnitely not safe for kids. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Shop-a-holic!

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I am a pro dog boarder and trainer. I purchased one of these gates a couple years ago and it was good. Purchased again recently and it is total junk. It does not work, the dogs push thru it. If tighten it to make it more stable the gate will not swing open. total junk. DONT BUY., IT DOES NOT IN ANY WAY KEEP DOGS SAFE OR CONFINED. JUNK
customer_reviews.author: Alaya

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe safety gate.
customer_reviews.text: This gate is pretty inexpensive but it's also cheap. I bought two and I suppose they serve my purpose but I was pretty upset after very poor welds left a three inch long scratch on my son's leg. My wife simply walked through one of the gates carrying him just a few minutes after I finished installing these but as you can see in the pictures there were very sharp jagged burrs from poor welds right at the top of the passageway. I ground them down with my rotary tool but I'll never buy from this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Darbee

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and secure for a doorway. Wouldn't recommend it for stairs!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great walk-through gate to keep children out of certain rooms (or in others!). It's quick and easy to install and it's quite secure using the tension system. However since it doesn't screw into the doorway (just compression) I wouldn't recommend using it for stairs, and with enough force I can see this sliding out with a determined enough kid. (Not likely, but certainly possible).
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: Buy them! The bad reviews are a load of ...
customer_reviews.text: These gates are great! Just buy them already. Whoever is giving negative reviews can't read directions or aren't mechanically inclined. I did get extra rubber stoppers so as not to ruin my walls, worth it. Took 10ish minutes by myself, easy peasy. It could be more of a two step open with the safety lock but for now my 9 month old can't figure it out so I don't use the lock. Just the handle. Way better than those brown gates you have to move for sure! And a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: I can yank it out of place easily (without the wall cups that require drilling into the walls)
customer_reviews.text: The pressure mount does not work for us at all. I (a petite woman) can yank it out of place easily with one hand. There is the option of putting on wall cups to secure it but that requires drilling. My whole purpose of choosing this one is to not drill holes in the walls. I am very disappointed that I have to take it all apart to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Xu

customer_reviews.title: Spindle rods defect
customer_reviews.text: I was having an easy time assembling the gate when I got to the spindle Rods and that’s when I read that once you put the spindle rods into each of the four corners of the gate that you would be able to take them back out. I’m guessing that’s where this products sturdiness comes from. However I put the rods in and out with ease. Which has made attempting to install it an absolute headache. Did I miss a step. Tried calling the company but no use. Couldn’t find anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the same gate as before
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT the same gate as before. I have two regalo baby gates that I purchased around 1 year ago and this gate is nowhere near the same quality. The melds are not even making contact with the rest of the gate and now the center part that opens up has to be assembled with multiple pieces when it used to be one solid piece. You now have to use 2 screws to hold the center gate together which mine was missing. The opening mechanism also feels cheaper and flimsy. I will not be using regalo baby gates anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Rozalin

customer_reviews.title: Not as described!!
customer_reviews.text: The installation is much more difficult than in the description. It involves drilling and mounting brackets for the pressure mounts to “sit” in. Also requires two adults to assemble Bc one person has to hold up the gate and another person has to adjust and assist with marking on the wall where the holes are to be drilled. I have a brand new house and I’m not drilling into the wood doorways! Waste of time and money!!
customer_reviews.author: rachel lambert

customer_reviews.title: Love it 😊
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people stated the gate came with a defect but it is because they must not have read the brightly attached paper (see photos). This gate works well and is so much easier to use than my previous gate I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Poor design. Does not fit 34” inch doorway
customer_reviews.text: I have a 34” doorway I needed this for. That size maxes the gate out for its length so it’s super flimsy and won’t stay tight in the hall way at all. The mounts that go to the wall literally fall out if you push on it at all. The whole thing falls out of place. The gate comes with an extension piece but it’s a couple inches to big for that size doorway.! There is about a 3” “gap” where this gate just won’t fit. If you’re hallway is 34-37” ish inches, This won’t fit. Disappointed with such a poor design
customer_reviews.author: Maria D

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Safe
customer_reviews.text: No need to drill holes in the walls if you're renting. Our "doorway" into the kitchen is very wide so we set the gate up between the leg of our dining table and the wall. With the twist rods, we can easily apply pressure between those two surfaces. The gate has a strong grip but the baby can weaken it as he tampers with it. So keep checking sturdiness! Overall, the instructions are simple! No screwdriver needed, there's a little one included. Our son does play and pull on the bars but he hasn't hurt his fingers or anything. I am satisfied with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Errol

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on 34 inch opening!
customer_reviews.text: This unit will not work on a 34 inch opening do not buy it if you’re opening is in fact 34 inches. The extension that they shipped is too big will not fit in 34 inch opening without the extension the expansion bolts will round very badly. Read the reviews are several comments on 34 inch openings! What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Solid and simple
customer_reviews.text: These are great! We use one with the extension at the top of our stairs, and one without the extension in our kitchen doorway. This is the easiest gate to open (can do it one handed) and is really sturdy (30lb toddler can stand on/try to climb it and it doesn't budge). Because the pressure mount involves a ton of winding, I wouldn't recommend it if you're hoping to move it around to different doorways at it would be laborious. Also worth noting that the opening is very narrow! Hubs and I are not small people and almost have to go through it sideways, which is especially tricky at the top of the stairs carrying a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Kanitha

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra $20 for this gate. It’s the best door gate.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I waited to buy this. I kept being super cheap and getting the little removable gates from box stores that are plastic webbing and such. This was a quick and easy install. Fits perfectly in the doorway. The door swings easily. My toddlers have already mastered how to use it. (We got the gate to keep the dogs out of their part of the house) spend the extra $20 and get this gate. Now I don’t have to constantly complain bc the gate is on the floor or knocked over.
customer_reviews.author: Christina R

customer_reviews.title: Cheap & badly designed, unable to install safely
customer_reviews.text: Our pretty standard sized hallway is too narrow by about 3” for using the extension piece, but without it, we cannot get the gate installed in a way that allows us tk both tension the screws *and* open the latch. Either the screws are tight & unit is secure/not wobbly across hallway but the walk-through gate portion won’t open, or we loosen it so gate will open & the entire top of the unit wobbles enough that I do not trust it to not tip over if my children push on the top at all. Unfixable as it’s the tensioning screws that wobble, there is no way to make them more secure.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Not for stairs - dangerous trip bar across the bottom
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our stairs and think it would be extremely dangerous for stairs. There is a bar across the bottom of the gate so if your foot were to catch this on your way down the stairs you and baby would go toppling down the stairs! It didn’t work for the bottom of the stairs either, since our stair rails are in the middle of the step, which means gate and bottom bar also go across the center of the step, leaving no space for your foot on that step, meaning we’d have to step over/skip that step, also extremely dangerous. Not sure how this gate has such high reviews, perhaps most people use on a single level?
customer_reviews.author: Jordans

customer_reviews.title: Doing great - 6 months outside use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! We’ve been using this product outside for 6 months straight in the rainy PA weather. We put it out the very beginning of April so it has lasted our rainy season. There is one spot of rust (see photos), but I think it rusted there because that part of the gate never sees the sun and gets a chance to dry. We are using the product on siding, but that wouldn’t be possible without the added protectors we bought. I think without protectors it might poke a hole through the siding. We will continue to use it outside until it snows and then we’ll probably bring it in.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis Others

customer_reviews.title: Works well to protect stairs
customer_reviews.text: A bit wobbly when setting it up, but once it is installed it works well. In our case, we set the gate up as needed, and as a result it is often dismantled for storage. It is a bit of pain to store, since the end of the gate comes off, and the 4 adjustment screws come off as well. We ended up putting all the parts in a plastic bag, and taping the plastic bag to the main gate. The gate opens and closes well, as long as you align the halves of the unit properly when installing. Overall, the gate works well, and provides the protection against falls that we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with a defective threaded spindal rod
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these gates. One was perfectly fine and installed without issue. The second shipped with a defective threaded spindal rod (the piece used to create the tension that holds the gate in place). The adjustment wheel doesn’t stay in the threading. I’m pretty shocked this piece made it though QC. If it fails when the gate is in place this is a huge safety issue. Their phone line operates on a limited central time zone schedule making getting a replacement ordered when you have time (on the weekend) impossible.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Lacks simple safety. Okay for dogs & rooms, bad for stairs and babies.
customer_reviews.text: So let me clarify I bought this To keep my dog from running around upstairs, and it does work for that purpose... but flimsily. It’s easy to set up in minutes as well. However, the ends not screwing in “by design” is really poor design in my opinion because they easily fall out of the gate gets bumped or knocked in any way. Against stairs, it’s even more flimsy. Furthermore, the extra attachment for length also has no way to solidify the connection and so it’s just as flimsy overall. Great for bigger dogs, but I don’t know if I would use around a baby as it could easily fall apart in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mathieu

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions people, this is a NICE gate!!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be more happy with this gate. For the uninformed that keep leaving negative reviews; how about you read the instruction manual instead of jumping to conclusions. It clearly says in the manual and the orange tag hanging on it that it comes from the factory with a gap and when you put the threaded feet in to mount to the wall and adjust them, the gap will disappear! This gate is made of metal and strong. I love the fact that it has an open gate feature so I can leave it set up full time for my dogs and be able to walk through it instead of taking it up and down like the cheap wooden gates. A+
customer_reviews.author: Attention Amazon Shoppers...

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well in 35 inch wide hallways.
customer_reviews.text: Beacuse I have a base molding this product will not work. The bottom width of my hallway is 34”, while the top width is 35.5”. So if I put the extender in, the feet at the bottom won’t fit. But if I keep the extender out, the top feet are not long enough to securely hold the gate in place. Seems like an engineer though everything was great on paper, but it wasn’t properly tested in practice. So if you have the same top/bottom dimensions, this product won’t work (but it will cause you a lot of frustration).
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: One of my best baby purchases so far
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this gate. When you have a crazy toddler anything that can make life even marginally easier is huge. I've been fighting with other gates for months because my husband didnt want to drill anything permanent into the walls. This solved all those issues. We've put it on our little guy's doorframe and it's so easy to use. He also tries to hulk his way though every gate and this is study enough to resist his efforts. I would be hesitant to use at the top of stairs because it does have a lip you need to step over so would worry about a tripping hazard but highly recommend for any doorways or flat surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne T

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly when fully expanded. NOT for top of stairway.
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish were reasonable, but design is pretty lame. When used to span at its widest settings, feels VERY wobbly and insecure. Gate opening is quite narrow and does not stay open on its own. Catch does not re-lock on its own when gate closes. Will be fine on narrow doorways, but propensity to wobble tells me this would be unsafe on a stairway, especially at the top, and especially when using the extender. It takes very little weight to overwhelm this gate. Anything over 20 pounds (9kg) will easily knock it down. Pay more for a better quality gate if safety is your number one priority.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jolliff

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and nice looking gates are a step up
customer_reviews.text: So easy to install and use! These are a million times better than the wooden pressure mounted ones we’d been using. We use three of these to keep our rambunctious puppy limited to a few rooms at a time. They look great and function really well - no more struggling over or through flimsy gates with a laundry basket on my hip. Totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: MY ERROR but...
customer_reviews.text: I got the size mixed up needed 48" not 38" that's on me. BUT once you put the gate piece together with it's side piece you CAN'T take it apart to send it BACK. SO I'm suck with it. Not a happy camper. Went a head ordered the 48" thought maybe could interchange the two pieces of gate with the 38" [YOU CAN'T JUST DIFFERENT ENOUGH WON'T WORK] The 48" also seems not to be built a well as the 38". PLUS I got it to block off my kittens from part of the house , they can go through the bars of the gate. Oh well live and learn
customer_reviews.author: Catlover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: So. I have a newly walking 10 month old and she gets into literally everything. I wanted a gate for my kitchen doorway and this one is AMAZING. Perfect for what i needed it for. I was a little worried about it being just a tiny bit too big to put in my doorway but its perfect. The people saying that the door is too far from the bar to lock it, its supposed to be that and it meets the bar when you tighten it into wherever its going. Its easy to put together, easy to lock and unlock, easy to move if need be. Anyway. Im buying another one for my hallway. Thank youuuuu!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Franchesca R.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 4 baby gates so far. Different companies and sizes and is by far the worst product I've bought from Amazon in a while. It is terribly designed. The metal was not placed in a manner that allowed for appropriate tension. The bolts that came with it where the wrong size for the Allen wrench. The way it was designed it would not fit in exactly 34 inch spaces. The space would have to be an inch bigger or in smaller. I highly recommend you buy North State.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Possible choking hazard
customer_reviews.text: My review is based on having used it for about 1 month or so. Unfortunately, I found my 9 month old daughter with a small piece of white plastic in her mouth. The piece came from the gate that she clearly found and out in her mouth. Thank god I found her when I did and got it out of her mouth. I would not recommend this product. I would also return it but The return window has closed. I caution buying this product as there are small pieces that can come loose.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Keep toddler out of big kid's room
customer_reviews.text: We bought this gate to keep my toddler (2 years) out of his preschooler big brother's room. My preschooler (5 years) is really into Legos, but that's obviously a nightmare with little brother around. So this provides a way for my offer son to be able to get in and out of his room (easy enough for him to open and close on his own) without little brother being able to sneak in and destroy his Lego sets. I also love that it doesn't automatically slam closed like some gates, so that we can keep it open at night for my preschooler to be able to easily go to the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Sagum

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these, and have had them for maybe ten months. Our 20 month old can now open both of them. We have standard doorways and one of the gates appears to have a defective bottom slot, so the bottom screw can only be tightened to a certain point. We're looking at having to add a twisty tie to the gate to keep our son from opening the stair gate. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Marginally OK
customer_reviews.text: The gate seems sturdy enough for most uses and is reasonably easy to assemble. However, those who complain about the gap between the closing mechanism and the post are probably correct. At least in my case, there is a serious defect here. For my purposes-- keeping a small dog out of a room -- a bungee cord solves the problem. Not elegant, significantly defective. Two stars is generous. If a make-do like my bungee cord won't work for you, be prepared to send it back if yours, too, is defective. Seems to be a quality control issue, unless I'm missing something.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Wise

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I bought this to keep my two year old separated from her sisters while doing at-home schooling. It was easy to install and took about 20 minutes from start to finish. My doorway is 38" and this fits well with the gate extender it came with. With the extra length it is a tiny bit shaky but not to the point it's not usable. The door is easy to open for myself and the older kids ages 6, 7, and 8. All in all I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miriah

customer_reviews.title: Good Strong Gate, also Quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gate of 3 gates I have. The others are noisy, this one is very quite and super easy to use. This gate (says extra wide) don't let that throw you. What they mean is, an extra extension is included to make it wider than a standard door framb. It fits a standard door opening and has adjustments to lock in and fit tight. I especially like the grey lock that prevents a child from opening it. You can use the grey lock or keep it disabled and just use the sliding mechanism to open and close it.
customer_reviews.author: De Oppresso Liber

customer_reviews.title: Great gate for babies and dogs
customer_reviews.text: We're very happy with this purchase. We bought 2 gates and they fit perfectly in the two doorways that we bought them for. One is for the nursery so our little one can wander freely around his room as he begins to explore and wants more freedom. The other is for our kitchen to keep our dog out because she likes to be underfoot while we're cooking. Both get leaned on regularly and are standing up well to the abuse. They were a tad tricky to install but fine once I wrapped my head around it. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDad

customer_reviews.title: Defective.
customer_reviews.text: This gate came with defective metal on the bottom, where the screws keep the entire thing together. If you zoom in on my photo you will see where the metal has actually snapped and peeled backward, allowing the bolts to completely fall through. I am not very happy because I ordered this for a family child care home, and now I have to wait almost two weeks for a replacement to come. If the replacement shows up with no damage, I will update my review but for now, this is a terrible purchase and not at all safe for children or pets in my opinion. VERY cheap metal.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: We got this to keep our 10 lbs Yorkie off the stairs. Instructions were very clear and it was super easy to assemble. When we got it, we actually put off putting it together for a few days because we were dreading the hassle but it took like 5 minutes. Love how easy the latch is to open and close. And it’s way sturdier than my previous gate. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: worst product
customer_reviews.text: sent me a wrong product which doesnt work, i ordered this as my son is less than 2 yrs old and want to keep him away from steps since slipped and fell down once from stairs. this gate is faulty, none works even after i installed everything. the gate lock doesn't fit properly and had very hard time adjusting it, but failed. ordered this product after reading positive reviews here, but screwed up my walls drilling nails for this faulty product. i don't recommend this product at all, not at all satisfied. even returning this product is waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Avanthi Chava

customer_reviews.title: Screws are a serious safety concern.
customer_reviews.text: Install could have been easier. It requires screwing into your door jambs. This wouldn't be so bad but the screws they give you are what I believe to be plastic. I would not trust my child's safety to these. Part of this rating is to get the attention of the manufacturer. I will gladly change this review to a 5-star if they included proper hardware. For now, I'm leaving a 1 star for going cheap on infant/child/pet safety.
customer_reviews.author: QwikF3

customer_reviews.title: So easy to put together. It installs in like 5 mins.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second gate purchased from REGALO. The first one was the taller wall thru gate and I loved it. So, I bought this smaller one for my small dog. These gates are very durable. I’ve had guess run into it because they don’t lift their feet up high enough and it’s jist as steady as a rock. The gate is also versatile because it comes with an extension if you needed it for a larger framed door. I would highly recommend this gate if you need it for small animals or children. It works great for my dog and my grand daughter. I love that it’s walk thru. No more stepping over those old wooden gates. A++++
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne

customer_reviews.title: Well made & Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a dog gate and it’s working well. She’s a border collie mix who can jump and she doesn’t even try to take this on so I’m very pleased with the height. The instructions were clear and it was very easy to install alone. I like that it comes with an extension piece (even though we don’t need it currently.) I secured it without using the cups that attach to the wall and it feels very sturdy. I wish the stickers on the gate were easier to remove and that the opening to walk through was a little wider but overall this is a great product for our needs!
customer_reviews.author: CALI DECARO

customer_reviews.title: Way better than stepping over a gate!
customer_reviews.text: Being 5'3, it can be a pain stepping over regular dog gates. This is infinitely easier; we only have a small dog, no young children, so we don't use the grey locking mechanism, and it's super easy to open & close ONE HANDED. We have it set up in our back doorway by our carport, so we can leave it open for air flow, and keep fluffy dog inside. Bringing in groceries, going out for a walk holding leash and stuff, sooooo much easier. Only wish we had done this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: K.K.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite baby gate
customer_reviews.text: We bought this same baby gate about a year and a half ago and love it. But we just barely bought a second for another doorway and they have changed the design. Both are good, but I do prefer the old style with the red lock. The new style has a nice feature where the handle can stay open and the gate can be fully free swinging, but overall I preferred the old style. An amazing gate either way though and absolutely recommend for those areas you are constantly needing a gate for!
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit a 33" opening
customer_reviews.text: The description is pretty clear in stating what openings the gate will fit. I have a 33" opening, and the gate wouldn't work. Without the extension, the gate was too small - it was wobbly, and I couldn't extend the rubber feet enough to push the latch area together and close the gap so the gate worked. If I added the extension, it was too large for the opening. It appeared pretty sturdy and well-made - it just wouldn't fit where I needed it. I believe the seller needs to amend the description somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly ATop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Bottom lock does not move to locked position
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give this gate 5 stars but the bottom lock just doesn't move whatsoever I've tried everything it literally does not move the top is fine everything else is fine about the gate the pressure cuffs though do not work for a baby so if you need to do it and make sure you use the wall screwing cups because my child pushed it right out of the doorway and I put it as tight as it can possibly go and it would still allow the door open I had to screw in the little wall cups to make sure she couldn't push it out of the doorway and she's only 8 months old.
customer_reviews.author: kayla Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible. I’ve had to pay two handy mans to come and attempt to get this to work and they can’t. Don’t know if mine is a defect but there’s no tension, the gate lock doesn’t even get near it because there’s no tension and even with the wall mounts it just falls off. Worst product ever. Can’t replace it because I’ve already thrown away the boxes. And I’ve put together numerous baby gates for my dog over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Hdueitt

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS GOOD AS EARLIER VERSION
customer_reviews.text: I bought another gate because I was so happy with the first one. It's been changed...and not for the better. The first gate had some give- some wiggle room- with the latch. This one has none. Therefore, it can't be secured as tightly to the walls. The babies can pull it out of position. A notch was also added to the bottom of the gate. The result? It has to be slightly lifted each time to close it. Couldn't you just have kept the old design????
customer_reviews.author: A. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, terrible execution
customer_reviews.text: This sucks, this is what you get with terrible quality control. Finish is near perfect, looks great, appears to be very sturdy. Showed up bent, in towards the door, even though it was bent the gate would not connect with its stop. Frame was welded incorrectly. This sucks so much. This is the second unit I ordered, the first one was used, box was damaged, unit itself had wear marks and missing parts. I get this one, box is perfect, totally packed up from the factory, I put it together and the damn thing is made wrong, I can’t make it work. Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed. Great gate.
customer_reviews.text: This gate is great. I was hoping it would work well in our house and it has. We unexpectedly got a new dog and I’m too old to be climbing over a traditional child gate. My husband got it set up in a matter of minutes and the door is way to open and close. I like the extra piece at the bottom for when you want to make sure the door is shut tight and you wouldn’t want something pressing against the bottom to get through. We didn’t use the pieces that you screw into the door frame and it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E Guess

customer_reviews.title: Wish I understood it had to have very strong pressure to work
customer_reviews.text: I need this to block off an area between my couch and counter from my dog. Unfortunately, the couch doesn't create the pressure this gate needs to close. Not excited about having to return it. It basically has to be in a doorway. For me it just keeps buckling out and falling over and doesn't create enough pressure to actually close the gap. I also can't take it apart to return it because the little piece that pops in is impossible to pop back out so I'm incredibly frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley24

customer_reviews.title: Just Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Bought them to use for dog gates. They don’t stay in place well. The opening is not that wide if you’re putting them across stairways so if you’re carrying things upstairs you’re going to knock this over. They don’t stay in place well and they’re so irritating to open we just ended up climbing over once we finally got them stable. Also if my 6 pound puppy could move it and knock it over occasionally, I would chose differently for a child . The high point was the delivery person leaving them on my neighbors porch which caused confusion for us and an entertaining loud conversation for them. Lol!
customer_reviews.author: Elle Arms

customer_reviews.title: Nice gate, solid and effective
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid gate, it includes all needed hardware and an extension if needed. Assembly and installation are simple and straightforward. The latching system is also easy for an adult to use left or right handed. Be aware this gate will reduce the door opening to about 18" and the base of the frame will create a 11⁄2" trip hazard. If you have someone with limited mobility this could be a concern. Overall a great, nice looking gate. I would, without hesitation rerecommend this product to a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: Navyvette

customer_reviews.title: Easier then expected and extremely helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install! I was nervous to purchase bc people with previous reviews showed bowing in the middle however when we started to notice that I realized we just installed it incorrectly with to much pressure it was an incredibly easy thing to figure out. We also did not drill the cups into our wall since we have an older home with plaster we are just using the tension and I tighten the tension rods every couple weeks and it’s held up to a 1yr / 5yr / 9yr without coming off the wall so I’d say thus far it’s been great! If you follow the instructions you’ll be happy with the product. What a concept 🙃.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Christlieb

customer_reviews.title: Works great !!
customer_reviews.text: Got this gate after having several fails with other brands. I have one older son and one baby that just started walking. I wanted a gate that one could use and the other couldn’t. This works perfect. Only wish I had started with this one rather than wasting money and time on the cheaper ones. It was an inch short for my desired area but get the wall pressure mount protectors from amazon or somewhere and it gave me the extra inch to fill the gap and protects the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Great on doors a nightmare on the stairs
customer_reviews.text: Can’t bend over. Need something that is easy to adjust. This is not it. I have a senior in the home and two small dogs that need to be supervised. As a result I Bought these specific gates to keep them out of certain areas and prevent my mother from climbing over gates. Well per the video my little one Lila got through the gate. It’s sturdy . It is also a pain in the butt to install. You have to screw it secure for the door latch to work. It works well on doors but horribly on staircases.
customer_reviews.author: Nubien Lazo Princess

customer_reviews.title: Works great at bottom of the stairs
customer_reviews.text: After attempting a few other styles of gates, We installed this gate at the bottom of our stairs. One side is a metal railing and the other has thick molding at the bottom so we needed something that would fit in a non uniform space. With two people, we were able to install the gate in about fifteen minutes. As others mention, the opening is not large and with the extension in place, the gate is not as sturdy as it could be. Other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mkane23

customer_reviews.title: bit of work to put together.
customer_reviews.text: My personal wall/width dimensions were right between the two options, so the short segments were too short but the long ones were too long. I ended up using the long ones and just put them at the absolute shortest setting I could get to. I used it for about a year with a lab puppy--me knowing full well she could jump it if she tried, though she never did--it worked well until she was better trained and we only took it down because we no longer needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Amie Anne

customer_reviews.title: Love these walk through gates
customer_reviews.text: These walk through gates are the best. Ordered this for the twins bedroom door. Works like a charm. Only thing that slightly annoys me is that you have to pull back the lever to shut it as well as when you open it. Others we have around the house you can just push it down to shut and lock into place. Something small but if you aren’t used to anything else you’ll not be bothered by this small inconvenience I’m sure. Would definitely recommend for parents of little ones or fur babies.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Constructed
customer_reviews.text: I loved this gate at first. It fits the space perfectly (yes, you do have to read the directions), and it's easy for adults and my 6 year old to open and close. However, my one year old pulled on one of the bars a couple times and it broke off from the top of the gate. It left behind a sharp metal edge I'm afraid my child will cut his fingers on.
customer_reviews.author: CSSmith

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This gate does what it needs to and gets the job done. This is the second one we purchased, needed an additional it’s not like the one we had broke. I will say that the one we purchased last year seems to have a better quality latch. This new one seems flimsy and might be hollow because it makes an odd sound. The latch is also a little wobbly but I think I can fix that. We installed the jamb stoppers that hold it in place and they work perfectly. We didn’t with the other gate and my kids kept knocking it over. We fixed them both in place and the gates themselves are very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Gate bottom stuck/sticking
customer_reviews.text: Tried to install in front of our stairs, but found that once tightened properly, the bottom corner of the gate under the latch is lower than the bottom bar it is supposed go over. You can force it on top, but it pops off hard and won't go back over unless you bend over and shove it on. Tried to adjust all the screws many times, but still couldn't get it workable. I suspect the problem is the extension, as it is half the width of the bottom bar (not like the pictures in the listing) and seems like it could be causing bowing in the wrong place. Will probably be returning.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the time being
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these to put on our stairs to help stop our son from going up and down. They were a little challenging to get setup all the way and get things lined up to screw into the wall, but they're great now. I give them 4 stars because of the sturdiness, mainly, and the little bit of difficulty installing on the stairs. I worry for when our son gets older and stronger and could possibly pull these out of the wall. They're pretty flimsy, but I think they'll work for now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hales

customer_reviews.title: overall good gate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gate to contain my 14-lb terrier in a hallway while I'm out of the house. Unfortunately, she learned to jump over it because I was also monitoring her on Nest cam and noticed she had escaped. There is a taller version of this gate that is 3 inches higher, but I'm afraid she will eventually learn to jump over that is well. If your dog doesn't have major separation anxiety to the point of jumping to escape, this is a pretty good gate and super easy to assemble. The only negative is that the gate only swings in one direction. However, once open, the door will stay where it is and not swing back closed.
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: Puppy is able to fit though the bars
customer_reviews.text: Gates work just fine but my 15 week old Lab puppy was able to fit her head though the part where the gate meets the extension and squeezed though. We had to tape some cardboard to it so she couldn't get though. Not a bad product but if you have a small dog or puppy be careful when using the extension. Opening is about 42in
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Best gate I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This gate is easy to put together and the best gate I have ever used. The latch is easy to use and open when walking through. I am using it in our bedroom doorway because I have a new puppy who is not potty trained yet and we have carpet in the bedroom. I always bought those little $10 wooden gates that you have to step over and I got tired of feeling like I had an obstacle course in my house so I bought this gate. I'm not sure why I waited so long. I love this gate and will never go back.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I’m so upset with this purchase...they didn’t give me two of the most important screws for my gate...the two that go in the center of the gate to keep it together. If it were just the regular screws that I have in my garage then that wouldn’t be a big deal but I don’t know what size these screws are or anything because they don’t look like the regular ones. Now I have to figure out a way to jerry rig it. Great.
customer_reviews.author: Tell

customer_reviews.title: Garbage design and materials
customer_reviews.text: This product is garbage the screws broke during installation, so I had to get my own screws for it, and after installing it I notice that it would not keep pressure within the walls, it was so weak that my 1 year old could bring it down. I also had to get an extension from Regalo and since I returned the broken gate to Amazon I had to return the extension to regalo and they wanted me to cover the shipping cost to return their crap to them, ridiculous!! I've installed several baby gates for my home and for friends and family and I could tell you this was just garbage don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: missy atencio

customer_reviews.title: Stable, easy to operate/pass through, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy and quick to install, is secure, and the latch is simple to use. I did use it along with wall protectors (at the bottom, where the baseboards are andat the top where they are directly on the wall). It remains secure, without any wall damage, and, again, was easy to install and would be easy to remove and replace or move (though I have yet to have a reason to do so).
customer_reviews.author: J. Nowak

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, only install somewhere critical if you use the wall cups
customer_reviews.text: This gate is very useful at the bottom of our stairs. While it feels pretty stable, it definitely wouldn't be strong enough to break your fall. The gap is there on purpose, everyone, and it says that in a good 4 or 5 places. When you tighten it to the proper tension against the wall, the gap will be gone. The rubber feet are good and grippy under pressure, but you need to drill the extra included mounts into the wall to even consider putting it at the top of stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase but did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gate for my special needs child (age 3). The idea of the gate and the wall screws seemed perfect however it didn't work for us as he is too strong. He very quickly figured out how to work both bottom and top locks so we started over screwing it closed so the door wouldn't move even when unlatched and he simply ripped the gate off the hinge. I think this would work great for small children and pets but it's difficult to find saftey products for a child that at 3 has the strength of a teenager.
customer_reviews.author: B reid

customer_reviews.title: Flawed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this since it was the kind you don't need to screw into the wall. It might just be my doorframe but you have to have it insanely tight for it slips and can be pushed over. The screw kind might of been better. It also has a huge flaw in the top gate. It looks like it was soddered together and painted to cover it up. It is pretty sharp so I had to file it down. It was still sharp so I wrapped cloth around it. It will work for the price but not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Matthies

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous, Child Fell While Using All Safety Precautions
customer_reviews.text: My one year old opened this up in seconds (it was properly installed and the latch was shut with child lock in place), and I watched him fall down the stairs! Yes, I was using this with supervision but he opened it so fast I couldn't prevent him from falling. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. It is too easy for a baby to open. I wish I could get my money back. Extremely dangerous, should not be sold. Just shut your child in a room upstairs if you have to, don't use this.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This works well, but is bending at the extension points. Hopefully it will hold up long term. It's easy to open and close, our puppy can't get through it, and it hasn't fallen down at all. Keep in mind it only opens in one direction, so be sure it's facing the right way when you set it up.
customer_reviews.author: sarahlc13

customer_reviews.title: Stay skinny, liked it enough to buy a second one.
customer_reviews.text: I have gained a few pounds durning the coronavirus, so it is a little more difficult to carry the baby and slip through smallish opening. It took a little time to figure out the assembly, but much easier the second time. I bought one for the bottom of the stairs, tested it out, then got a second for the top of the stairs. I liked it well enough that I bought two. I think it is a very good price. I also liked that it stays put without screwing it into the wall. Works well with the uneven surfaces of a stairs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great instead of hopping over!
customer_reviews.text: These are great instead of having to hop over the older wooden ones. I will say that it was easier to put together with another person but is able to be done solo ( just use a table chair to lean it against. It seems to hold up to a baby pulling on it and cats using the top part to jump over. The quality seems on point and overall I am happy with the purchase. I did not rate for stairs as we have them to block off the 2 doorways to the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Katlyn

customer_reviews.title: Best rigid gate we found.  Using for small animal.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality gate. Purchased for pet rabbit. Because the design is designed to various door openings the bar spacings can vary up to half inch which let a growing bunny through. Full grown bunny I think it will be fine. Thin plexiglass velcroed on solves the issue. Best gate we have seen. This is NOT a quick release gate, but it has a walk through 5/16/2015 Update: we purchased a second gate for a second larger doorway. Still works great for us, but it could be challenging for some sizes as the installation is not as flexible as a quick release.
customer_reviews.author: OSU Fan

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to tell if fully locked
customer_reviews.text: The gate is sturdy and easy to install, but the mechanism is far too easy to operate. I have an older regalo gate that requires some strength and coordination to open. This one you just have to lift a catch with no strength at all. My 20 month toddler worked this out in no time. Edit: after writing this I realized to my chagrin that there is a way to lock the catch by pushing down hard on it, and with this done the gate cannot be opened by a toddler. It’s not easy to tell just by looking at the gate if it has been properly locked or not, so I prefer the old mechanism still.
customer_reviews.author: jweob

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for stairs not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought This for my stairway so that my dog wouldn’t go up but it was too small so I had To make wood extensions on my Stair banister’s. I tried to install myself, and it was a little bit difficult it’s much easier with two people. Sturdiness... Not so much. My dog learned how to open the gate and can pull it open even when it is latched all the way shut. I constantly have to RECenter it because it falls off the banisters. Would not recommend for stairs probably works well in a doorway.
customer_reviews.author: Maribeth

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: It’s great, the only thing I have to complain about is when you bump into it by accident it can move out of place. Does what it needs to do though. Keeps dogs and baby out of the kitchen. It was a bit confusing putting it together, as it seemed the gate wouldn’t close, but once I put it completely together and had it in place in the doorway, the gate would close right. Just know if it seems to swing freely and won’t close, once you get it in the doorway and tighten the extender things, the gate will close.
customer_reviews.author: Chrimson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I think it took me 5 minutes max to put together this gate and install it. Instructions were easy to read. I put this gate up for my children's room so that the puppy could not get in. The gate handle to open is easy to use (I've had ones in the past that I could barley open) and my young children can open and close with ease. It does have a locking feature on the top and bottom if you do not want your kids to be able to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: great gate
customer_reviews.text: we use baby gates to keep our not-to-be-trusted-loose-in-the-house dog in the main living area with us. for the longest time we had one of these gates and one of the wooden pressure mounted gates. having the walk thru door is a must. our wooden gate finally broke so i spent the money on the second one of these and i can't believe i lived with the one i had to climb over, and my 8 year old couldn't get over, for so long! the gate is easy to install and stays in place, even without the screws in the wall to mount it. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sjones

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, strong gate!
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. Installed very easily and held tight. Got this to keep the dogs at bay, and worked for all but the old Border Collie, (too darn smart!) She grabbed the bottom with her teeth and pulled until she could slide the bottom wall cup protectors out (bought separately) then pushed gate forward to walk under it like a swing-up garage door. The gate swung back down, keeping the other dogs in! LOL. If we had screwed it into the wall as directed, this would not have happened. This was not the gate’s fault. We fixed our mistake and now even the Border Collie stays put. I’m very happy with this gate. Wished I’d gotten it long ago.
customer_reviews.author: River Rise

customer_reviews.title: Very good gate, but a very smart dog...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gate to contain my two 80 pound labs. It works great - as long as I remember to use the red locking mechanism. As you can see in the video, Boomer figured it out pretty quickly...
customer_reviews.author: is it me or what?

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my chichuahua terrier mix dog inside his room, and it is perfect. He doesn’t try to climb the gate, it is easy to open and close and the gate separation are not so wide that he can fit through, but not so small that it feels enclosed. It does take a little bit of pressure to get it to fit in the wall and it’s not really made to be taken on and off, like if you want to change it from place to place depending on the occasion, but it did the trick and now I don’t have to worry about Toby escaping from the room.
customer_reviews.author: flowergiggles

customer_reviews.title: 100% Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these gates or ones very similar. They are very easy to install, very sturdy & does exactly what it's supposed to. I've used them for my kids & my dogs. When my son was about 1 1/2 he would actually climb over the one at the bottom of the stairs to go upstairs. I had to buy another & I installed it upside down so he could not climb over it lol I wish I could find a picture. He was & still is a little crazy haha
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hall

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't find the type that we have in other rooms, picked this based on price. The locking mechanism would be great if we had toddlers or little kids, but we mainly use these to keep dogs out of rooms they're not supposed to be in, so the lock is overkill and sometimes a bit of a pain. Don't care for the fact that the door only swings one way -- on our older gates the door swings both ways, so it's a simple walk-through whether you're entering a room or leaving it. Otherwise, works great, good value.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Bodin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We have a 4 year old and a 9M old. We needed a baby gate for the playroom that my older child could open and close on her own for when she wants to play with small toys out of baby's reach, because let's be real, there's no way we were about to open and close a baby gate for her 20+ times a day. It took her all of 2 minutes to figure out how to work it on her own. Its exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Christina M Wing

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, getting a second one!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, looks and works great! There are two places we needed a dog gate. After busting my butt more than once trying to step over lower gates without doors I decided to try one of these. I’m buying a second one. It may not keep a cat out, but it works great for this little dog. I wish the gate would latch automatically when you close it. It doesn’t. You have to push the latch down. Not a huge deal
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Being a grandmother, I can tell you I am glad to see that this baby gates is a great improvement from wooden ones that fall over or thick heavy plastic ones that take super strength to pry open without pinching your fingers. Our family has purchased multiples of this gate. They fit every entryway, are easy to set up/take down and most importanly they have been stable. I would have liked a wider gate opening. It seems narrow but no one seems to have a problem going through it. The latch was a little tricky to figure out at first but once I did, it really is simple.
customer_reviews.author: heygur

customer_reviews.title: Slides and very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: After seven months of using this gate I can state that it is very flimsy and not well constructed at all. The only good part is the one handed opening feature. Other than that this gate will easily slide off the wall unless you use the extra fasteners that screw into the wall. If you are going to use the pressure fittings forget it. I would not trust this gate to confine a small toddler or dog as it can be easily pushed off the wall. Look elsewhere for something sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We got it for our laundry room to keep our dogs apart. We have an older dog that does not get along with our younger ones, so we put this up to our laundry room from our kitchen to keep them apart. 2 of our younger dogs are large/xlarge dogs and they can't push it over. The install is so easy and to use is even easier. Even if you don't have the clasp all the way down and locked, they cannot push on it to open it. And if you are using this for kids, it is perfect as well. Our nephew cannot get it open when it is in the locked mode.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs but suggest permanently installing gate
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to put together and fit my standard door without needing the extender (it’s nice that it came with it). My small dog (18 lbs) is VERY stubborn and figured out how to knock this out of the doorframe so I do recommend drilling the permanent fixtures into the wall which prevent the gate from being “pushed” out of the doorframe. At first I didn’t do this step because I wasn’t sure what part of my house the gate would work best in and I was able to move it around. If a shorter gate just like this existed then I would definitely buy that - to keep the dog in but allow the cat to still jump over!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I need a duo swing gate. This isnt it.
customer_reviews.text: Got this gate to keep my baby put of our dining/ kitchen area. It does great at that! Fits perfectly and was beyond easy to put together and install. It does exactly that! Now in one of the pictures you can see the one side of the latch is longer than the other this makes it to where the gate cannot swing both ways. It's very aggravating. If there was a way to shorten that piece to make it to the smaller size of the other side it'd be 5 stars! Tbh I may return it because it's so irritating.
customer_reviews.author: daniel webster

customer_reviews.title: Safe and sturdy! Love the clasp!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gate for near stairs or for those sneaky kiddos who are mechanically inclined. I purposefully looked for a gate with the locking clasp like this one has. I have a very curious and smart 15 month old who would open other walk thru gate styles. She is unable to open this one because of the clasp. I like the peace of mind of that locking “click” gives to know my child will not be able to open the gate keeping her safe from falling down the stairs. I’ve seen some cheaper, but I’ll pay for the safety and sturdiness that will work for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Narrow gate, awkward size.
customer_reviews.text: Every now and again I make the stupid mistake of buying something from amazon because it had a lot of reviews. This product is one of those mistakes. The actual gate of this product is way too narrow. It’s at least 2-3 inches more narrow than other name brand, higher quality gates. This makes it awkward to pass through while carrying anything—-like a baby. Additionally, the overall gate is too narrow for standard hallways, and with the included extension, it’s too wide. Leaving for an unstable fit due to the threads being maxed out on either side. Skip this one.. spend the extra 10-15 dollars to get a good gate.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: They also allow us to separate him from our dog (as he likes to pull on his ears pretty hard! )
customer_reviews.text: I really do not know how we would survive without these baby gates. We purchased several when our child was an infant and still use them two years later. They allow us to put him in a safe place when there is a spill that we need to clean up or just run to the restroom. They also allow us to separate him from our dog (as he likes to pull on his ears pretty hard!). We have also tried some of the cheaper removable gates, but they are pain. We now have only these in our house. They attach easily to any door and have lasted for two years now and are still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Upton

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a 33" opening
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for a 33" hallway. I needed to block both my baby and yorkie from going that way. The extension made it too tight. Therefore i had to unscrew the screws almost all the way making the gate much less study. With the screws all the way out, my dog can now walk right through the side of the gate... at least the baby is still blocked but the dog goes by whenever he pleases. I would also be afraid of my daughter trying to stand while holding this gate, again it is not very stable. Would definitely not get again.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

product_meta.title: Regalo Easy Step 38.5-Inch Extra Wide Walk Thru Baby Gate, Includes 6-Inch Extension Kit, 4 Pack Pressure Mount Kit, 4 Pack Wall Cups and Mounting Kit
product_meta.description:
Your baby has started to walk, it’s time to child proof your house. The Easy Step gate hits all the criteria with an all-steel construction, installs quickly by either pressure mount or wall mount and is adjustable to accommodate door openings between 29-34 inches or 35-38.5 inches wide. Space between the bars are 2.5 inches. The gate door is 16 inches wide. Please Read The gate WILL appear BENT before installation There WILL be a GAP at the handle before installation Both of these concerns will be eliminated once the gate is properly installed in your doorway Please measure your opening prior to purchase to ensure proper fit Gate frame design to be assembled at all times Regalo Easy Step Baby Gate Features Fits openings between 29-34 and 35-38.5 inches wide and stands 30 inches tall Easy to use lever handle features a one-touch release safety lock Convenient walk through design Easy pressure mount set up Made for children 6-24 months Can be used for medium to large dogs What’s Included in The Box One Regalo Easy Step Baby Gate Instruction Manual One 6-inch extension kit Four pressure mounted spindle rods Four wall cups with screws

BRAND STORY
By Regalo

BUYING GUIDE
This is a pressure mounted gate and must be pressured between an opening to properly function. When installed, the "2-inch" space between the bars is reduced by the pressure between the doorway or opening. Please note the top of page 3 within the Instruction Manual. The gate must be fully assembled within the doorway or opening to eliminate gap between the handle. Also, included in the packaging are wall cups that can be added to the gate for additional security. All of this information can be found within the Instruction Manual that is provided within the packaging.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Regalo Customer support number : 952-435-1080 or 866-272-5274. email : service@regalo-baby.com

See more
feature_bullets: EXTRA WIDE: Expands to fit openings between 29-34 and 35-38.5 inches wide. Stands 30 inches tall. Please be sure measure your opening prior to purchase to ensure proper fit. Note: This gate will not fit an opening between 34-35 Inch.

EASY TO USE AND SET UP: Pressure mount design that is quick to set up. Please note, before installation there will be a gap between the gate latch and the frame which is NOT a defect and it is NOT bent. This gap will be eliminated once installed.

ADJUSTABLE: Includes a 6-inch wide extension kit and 4 pressure mount spindle rods. Perfect for doorway, hallway and bottom of stair use. Gate can quickly be removed out of the opening for easy storage. Additional extensions sold separately.
DURABLE AND CONVENIENT: The all steel design is durable and convenient with a walk-through door. Certified to both JPMA and ASTM standards.

SAFETY: Includes multiple safety-lock features, four wall cups for added security and mounting hardware. Please note, gate frame is design to be assembled at all times. Perfect for children 6-24 months. Great for PETS TOO.
